intro: Amsinckia acuminata, commonly known as the desert smokeplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats. Amsinckia acuminata is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
